learning_objectives.objective: Define security unit testing and recall key OWASP WSTG categories relevant to it (e.g., IVT, AUT, ATH, SST, CRYP, Client-side Testing).
Explain the integration of security unit testing into the Secure Software Development Lifecycle (SDLC) and its extension from standard unit testing.
Implement a security unit test for a code snippet vulnerable to common issues like SQL injection (IVT) or weak cryptography (CRYP) using tools like JUnit or Pytest.
Compare security unit testing with other phases like integration testing, SAST, or DAST, identifying strengths and limitations.
Critique the effectiveness and coverage of a given security unit test suite, assessing risk mitigation for high-risk code units.
Design a comprehensive security unit test suite for a module (e.g., login handler) covering multiple OWASP categories and integrating into CI/CD.
